df-llines
blocks.content: Define the set of all "lattice lines" (lattice elements which cover an atom) in a Hilbert lattice ` k ` , in other words all elements of height 2 (or lattice dimension 2 or projective dimension 1). (Contributed by NM, 16-Jun-2012.)

blocks.name: df-lplanes
blocks.content: Define the set of all "lattice planes" (lattice elements which cover a line) in a Hilbert lattice ` k ` , in other words all elements of height 3 (or lattice dimension 3 or projective dimension 2). (Contributed by NM, 16-Jun-2012.)

blocks.name: df-lvols
blocks.content: Define the set of all 3-dimensional "lattice volumes" (lattice elements which cover a plane) in a Hilbert lattice ` k ` , in other words all elements of height 4 (or lattice dimension 4 or projective dimension 3). (Contributed by NM, 1-Jul-2012.)

blocks.name: df-lines
blocks.content: Define set of all projective lines for a Hilbert lattice (actually in any set at all, for simplicity). The join of two distinct atoms equals a line. Definition of lines in item 1 of [Holland95] p. 222. (Contributed by NM, 19-Sep-2011.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-lines(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(clines, cmpt(s0, universe, cab(s1, wrex(s2, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wrex(s3, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wa(wne(cv(s2), cv(s3)), wceq(cv(s1), crab(s4, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s4), cfv(cple, cv(s0)), co(cv(s2), cfv(cjn, cv(s0)), cv(s3)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-lines(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ Lines =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 | ‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà(Atoms ` s0), ‚àÉ(s3 ‚àà(Atoms ` s0),(s2 ‚â† s3 ‚àß s1 = { s4 ‚àà(Atoms ` s0)| s4[(le ` s0)](s2[(join ` s0)]s3)})))})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
}

blocks.name: df-pointsN
blocks.content: Define set of all projective points in a Hilbert lattice (actually in any set at all, for simplicity). A projective point is the singleton of a lattice atom. Definition 15.1 of [MaedaMaeda] p. 61. Note that item 1 in [Holland95] p. 222 defines a point as the atom itself, but this leads to a complicated subspace ordering that may be either membership or inclusion based on its arguments. (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-2011.)

blocks.name: df-psubsp
blocks.content: Define set of all projective subspaces. Based on definition of subspace in [Holland95] p. 212. (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-2011.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-psubsp(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cpsubsp, cmpt(s0, universe, cab(s1, wa(wss(cv(s1), cfv(catm, cv(s0))), wral(s2, cv(s1), wral(s3, cv(s1), wral(s4, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wi(wbr(cv(s4), cfv(cple, cv(s0)), co(cv(s2), cfv(cjn, cv(s0)), cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s4), cv(s1))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-psubsp(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ PSubSp =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { s1 |(s1 ‚äÜ(Atoms ` s0)‚àß ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà s1, ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà s1, ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà(Atoms ` s0),(s4[(le ` s0)](s2[(join ` s0)]s3)‚Üí s4 ‚àà s1)))))})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
}

blocks.name: df-pmap
blocks.content: Define projective map for ` k ` at ` a ` . Definition in Theorem 15.5 of [MaedaMaeda] p. 62. (Contributed by NM, 2-Oct-2011.)

blocks.name: llnset
blocks.content: The set of lattice lines in a Hilbert lattice. (Contributed by NM, 16-Jun-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm llnset(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, crab(s0, c3, wrex(s1, c4, wbr(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0))))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(ccvr, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(catm, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clln, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, crab(s0, c3, wrex(s1, c4, wbr(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0)))))), diffsc(s1, c4))
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, crab(s0, c3, wrex(s1, c4, wbr(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0))))), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  syl5eq(c2, crab(s0, c3, wrex(s1, c4, wbr(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0)))), cfv(clln, c0), wcel(c0, universe))
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, universe, clln, crab(s0, c3, wrex(s1, c4, wbr(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0)))), crab(s0, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), wrex(s1, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(ccvr, cv(hs0)), cv(s0)))))
  rabeqbidv(s0, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c3, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wrex(s1, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(ccvr, cv(hs0)), cv(s0))), wrex(s1, c4, wbr(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0))))
  syl6eqr(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(cbs, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, cbs)
  rexeqbidv(s1, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), c4, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(ccvr, cv(hs0)), cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0)))
  syl6eqr(cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), c4, cfv(catm, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, catm)
  breqd(cv(s1), cfv(ccvr, cv(hs0)), cv(s0), c5, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  syl6eqr(cfv(ccvr, cv(hs0)), c5, cfv(ccvr, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, ccvr)
  df-llines(hs0, s0, s1)
  rabex(s0, c3, wrex(s1, c4, wbr(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0))))
  fvexi(c3, cbs, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(crab(s0, c3, wrex(s1, c4, wbr(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0)))))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cbs, cv(hs0))
  diff.cbs.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm llnset(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí c2 = { s0 ‚àà c3 | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c4, s1[c5]s0)})
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Base ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(<o ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Atoms ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(LLines ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
} = {
  a1ii((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí c2 = { s0 ‚àà c3 | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c4, s1[c5]s0)}), d(s1, c4))
  syl(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 = { s0 ‚àà c3 | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c4, s1[c5]s0)}, c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  elex(c0, c1)
  syl5eq(c2, { s0 ‚àà c3 | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c4, s1[c5]s0)}, (LLines ` c0), c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, universe, clln, { s0 ‚àà c3 | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c4, s1[c5]s0)}, { s0 ‚àà(Base ` hs0)| ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà(Atoms ` hs0), s1[(<o ` hs0)]s0)})
  rabeqbidv(s0, (Base ` hs0), c3, hs0 = c0, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà(Atoms ` hs0), s1[(<o ` hs0)]s0), ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c4, s1[c5]s0))
  syl6eqr((Base ` hs0), c3, (Base ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, cbs)
  rexeqbidv(s1, (Atoms ` hs0), c4, hs0 = c0, s1[(<o ` hs0)]s0, s1[c5]s0)
  syl6eqr((Atoms ` hs0), c4, (Atoms ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, catm)
  breqd(s1, (<o ` hs0), s0, c5, hs0 = c0)
  syl6eqr((<o ` hs0), c5, (<o ` c0), hs0 = c0)
  fveq2(hs0, c0, ccvr)
  df-llines(hs0, s0, s1)
  rabex(s0, c3, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c4, s1[c5]s0))
  fvexi(c3, cbs, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 ‚àà c3 | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c4, s1[c5]s0)})
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cbs, hs0)
  diff.cbs.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: islln
blocks.content: The predicate "is a lattice line". (Contributed by NM, 16-Jun-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm islln(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(c2, c3), wa(wcel(c2, c4), wrex(s0, c5, wbr(cv(s0), c6, c2)))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(ccvr, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(catm, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(clln, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
} = {
  syl6bb(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wa(wcel(c2, c4), wrex(s0, c5, wbr(cv(s0), c6, c2))), wcel(c2, crab(hs0, c4, wrex(s0, c5, wbr(cv(s0), c6, cv(hs0))))))
  eleq2d(c2, c3, crab(hs0, c4, wrex(s0, c5, wbr(cv(s0), c6, cv(hs0)))), wcel(c0, c1))
  llnset(hs0, s0, c0, c1, c3, c4, c5, c6)
  elrab(hs0, c2, c4, wrex(s0, c5, wbr(cv(s0), c6, cv(hs0))), wrex(s0, c5, wbr(cv(s0), c6, c2)))
  rexbidv(s0, c5, wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wbr(cv(s0), c6, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s0), c6, c2))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c2, cv(s0), c6)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wrex(s0, c5, wbr(cv(s0), c6, c2)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm islln(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2 ‚àà c3 ‚Üî(c2 ‚àà c4 ‚àß ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c5, s0[c6]c2))))
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(<o ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(Atoms ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(LLines ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c5)
} = {
  syl6bb(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, (c2 ‚àà c4 ‚àß ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c5, s0[c6]c2)), c2 ‚àà { hs0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c5, s0[c6]hs0)})
  eleq2d(c2, c3, { hs0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c5, s0[c6]hs0)}, c0 ‚àà c1)
  llnset(hs0, s0, c0, c1, c3, c4, c5, c6)
  elrab(hs0, c2, c4, ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c5, s0[c6]hs0), ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c5, s0[c6]c2))
  rexbidv(s0, c5, hs0 = c2, s0[c6]hs0, s0[c6]c2)
  breq2(hs0, c2, s0, c6)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c5, s0[c6]c2))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: llni
blocks.content: Condition implying a lattice line. (Contributed by NM, 17-Jun-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm llni(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5)), wbr(c4, c6, c2)), wcel(c2, c7))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(ccvr, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(catm, c0))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(clln, c0))
} = {
  mpbir2and(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5)), wbr(c4, c6, c2)), wcel(c2, c7), wcel(c2, c3), wrex(hs0, c5, wbr(cv(hs0), c6, c2)))
  simpl2(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5), wbr(c4, c6, c2))
  3ad2antl3(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5), wbr(c4, c6, c2), wrex(hs0, c5, wbr(cv(hs0), c6, c2)))
  rspcev(hs0, c4, c5, wbr(c4, c6, c2), wbr(cv(hs0), c6, c2))
  breq1(cv(hs0), c4, c6, c2)
  syl(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5)), wbr(c4, c6, c2)), wb(wcel(c2, c7), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wrex(hs0, c5, wbr(cv(hs0), c6, c2)))), wcel(c0, c1))
  simpl1(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5), wbr(c4, c6, c2))
  islln(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c7, c3, c5, c6)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c4, c6, c2))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm llni(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  ‚ä¢ (((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß c4[c6]c2)‚Üí c2 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Base ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(<o ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(Atoms ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(LLines ` c0)
} = {
  mpbir2and(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß c4[c6]c2), c2 ‚àà c7, c2 ‚àà c3, ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà c5, hs0[c6]c2))
  simpl2(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, c4 ‚àà c5, c4[c6]c2)
  3ad2antl3(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, c4 ‚àà c5, c4[c6]c2, ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà c5, hs0[c6]c2))
  rspcev(hs0, c4, c5, c4[c6]c2, hs0[c6]c2)
  breq1(hs0, c4, c6, c2)
  syl(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß c4[c6]c2), (c2 ‚àà c7 ‚Üî(c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà c5, hs0[c6]c2))), c0 ‚àà c1)
  simpl1(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, c4 ‚àà c5, c4[c6]c2)
  islln(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c7, c3, c5, c6)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs0.w(c4[c6]c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: llnbase
blocks.content: A lattice line is a lattice element. (Contributed by NM, 16-Jun-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm llnbase(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(clln, c3))
} = {
  mpancom(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c3, universe))
  nsyl2(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c3, universe), wceq(cfv(clln, c3), emptycls))
  sylnib(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(clln, c3), emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls))
  n0i(c0, c1)
  eqeq1i(c1, emptycls, cfv(clln, c3))
  fvprc(c3, clln)
  simprbda(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2), wrex(hs0, cfv(catm, c3), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ccvr, c3), c0)))
  islln(hs0, c3, universe, c0, c1, c2, cfv(catm, c3), cfv(ccvr, c3))
  eqid(cfv(ccvr, c3))
  eqid(cfv(catm, c3))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)

thm llnneat(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  3expia(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, c3), wn(wbr(c1, cfv(cple, c0), c1)))
  llnnleat(c0, c1, c2, c1, c3, cfv(cple, c0))

blocks.name: llnexatN
blocks.content: Given an atom on a line, there is another atom whose join equals the line. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jun-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)

  simpl1(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4), wbr(c3, c5, c1))

  simpl2(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4), wbr(c3, c5, c1))
  llnbase(c1, c2, cfv(cbs, c0), c0)
  cvrval3(s0, c0, c3, cfv(cbs, c0), c1, cfv(ccvr, c0), c4, c5, c6)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(ccvr, c0))

  simpll3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4), wbr(c3, c5, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c4))

  ‚ä¢ (((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c4)‚àß c3[c5]c1)‚Üí ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c4,(c3 ‚â† s0 ‚àß c1 =(c3[c6]s0))))

  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)

  mpbid(((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c4)‚àß c3[c5]c1), ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c4,(c3 ‚â† s0 ‚àß c1 =(c3[c6]s0))), c3[(<o ` c0)]c1)

  3jca((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c4), c0 ‚àà HL, c3 ‚àà c4, c1 ‚àà c2)
  simp1(c0 ‚àà HL, c1 ‚àà c2, c3 ‚àà c4)

  syl3anc(((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c4)‚àß c3[c5]c1), (c3[(<o ` c0)]c1 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c4,(¬¨ s0[c5]c3 ‚àß(c3[c6]s0)= c1))), c0 ‚àà HL, c3 ‚àà(Base ` c0), c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0))

blocks.name: llncmp
blocks.content: If two lattice lines are comparable, they are equal. (Contributed by NM, 19-Jun-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm llncmp(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wb(wbr(c1, c4, c3), wceq(c1, c3)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cple, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clln, c0))
} = {
  impbid(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(c1, c4, c3), wceq(c1, c3))
  mpd(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wi(wbr(c1, c4, c3), wceq(c1, c3)), wrex(hs0, cfv(catm, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ccvr, c0), c1)))
  mpbid(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wrex(hs0, cfv(catm, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ccvr, c0), c1)), wcel(c1, c2))

thm llnnlt(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c3)))

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clln, c0))
} = {
  pm2.61dne(c1, c3, w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c3)))

  3adant3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c1)))
  pltirr(c0, chlt, c1, c2, c4)
  notbid(wceq(c1, c3), wbr(c1, c4, c1), wbr(c1, c4, c3))
  breq2(c1, c3, c1, c4)
  necon3ad(c1, c3, w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(c1, c4, c3))
  sylibd(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(c1, c4, c3), wceq(c1, c3), wbr(c1, cfv(cple, c0), c3))
  pltle(c0, chlt, c1, c2, c3, c2, c4, cfv(cple, c0))
  llncmp(c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(cple, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cple, c0))
}

  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cp0, c0))

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clln, c0))

  syl(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wa(wne(c1, c3), wne(co(c1, c4, c3), c5))), wcel(c0, cal), wcel(c0, chlt))
  hlatl(c0)

  syl6eqr(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(cbs, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))

blocks.content: A lattice plane is a lattice element. (Contributed by NM, 17-Jun-2012.)

thm lplnbase(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(clpl, c3))
} = {
  mpancom(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c3, universe))
  nsyl2(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c3, universe), wceq(cfv(clpl, c3), emptycls))
  sylnib(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(clpl, c3), emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls))
  n0i(c0, c1)
  eqeq1i(c1, emptycls, cfv(clpl, c3))
  fvprc(c3, clpl)
  simprbda(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2), wrex(hs0, cfv(clln, c3), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ccvr, c3), c0)))
  islpln(hs0, c3, universe, c0, c1, c2, cfv(clln, c3), cfv(ccvr, c3))
  eqid(cfv(ccvr, c3))
  eqid(cfv(clln, c3))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(clln, c3))
}

blocks.name: lvolex3N
blocks.content: There is an atom outside of a lattice plane i.e. a 3-dimensional lattice volume exists. (Contributed by NM, 28-Jul-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)

  syl13anc(((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c4)‚àß(hs0 ‚àà(Atoms ` c0)‚àß hs1 ‚àà(Atoms ` c0))‚àß(hs0 ‚â† hs1 ‚àß c3 =(hs0[(join ` c0)]hs1))), ¬¨ c1[c5](hs0[(join ` c0)]hs1), c0 ‚àà HL, c1 ‚àà c2, hs0 ‚àà(Atoms ` c0), hs1 ‚àà(Atoms ` c0))

thm 2atnelpln(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

} = {
  mt2d(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5), wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c4, c3)))

  hllat(c0)

  latref(c0, co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cple, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  ex(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5), wn(wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c4, c3))))
  syl13anc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5)), wn(wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c4, c3))), wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2))
  simpl1(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5))
  simpr(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5))
  simpl2(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5))

blocks.content: If two lattice planes are comparable, they are equal. (Contributed by NM, 24-Jun-2012.)

  syl31anc(((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2)‚àß(hs0 ‚àà(LLines ` c0)‚àß hs0[(<o ` c0)]c1 ‚àß c1[c4]c3)), hs0[(<o ` c0)]c3, c0 ‚àà HL, hs0 ‚àà(LLines ` c0), c3 ‚àà c2, hs0[c4]c3)

blocks.name: lplnexatN
blocks.content: Given a lattice line on a lattice plane, there is an atom whose join with the line equals the plane. (Contributed by NM, 29-Jun-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm lplnexatN(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4)), wbr(c3, c5, c1)), wrex(s0, c6, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), c5, c3)), wceq(c1, co(c3, c7, cv(s0))))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cple, c0))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cjn, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(catm, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(clln, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clpl, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
} = {
  mpbid(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4)), wbr(c3, c5, c1)), wrex(s0, c6, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), c5, c3)), wceq(c1, co(c3, c7, cv(s0))))), wbr(c3, cfv(ccvr, c0), c1))
  sylan(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4)), wbr(c3, c5, c1), wbr(c3, cfv(ccvr, c0), c1), w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c3, c4), wcel(c1, c2)))
  3jca(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4)), wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c3, c4), wcel(c1, c2))
  simp1(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4))
  simp3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4))
  simp2(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4))
  llncvrlpln2(c0, c3, c4, c1, c2, c5, cfv(ccvr, c0))
  syl6bb(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4)), wbr(c3, c5, c1)), wbr(c3, cfv(ccvr, c0), c1), wrex(s0, c6, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), c5, c3)), wceq(c1, co(c3, c7, cv(s0))))), wrex(s0, c6, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), c5, c3)), wceq(co(c3, c7, cv(s0)), c1))))
  syl3anc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4)), wbr(c3, c5, c1)), wb(wbr(c3, cfv(ccvr, c0), c1), wrex(s0, c6, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), c5, c3)), wceq(co(c3, c7, cv(s0)), c1)))), wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c3, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  simpl1(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4), wbr(c3, c5, c1))
  syl(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4)), wbr(c3, c5, c1)), wcel(c3, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c3, c4))
  simpl3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4), wbr(c3, c5, c1))
  llnbase(c3, c4, cfv(cbs, c0), c0)
  syl(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4)), wbr(c3, c5, c1)), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c1, c2))
  simpl2(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c4), wbr(c3, c5, c1))
  lplnbase(c1, c2, cfv(cbs, c0), c0)
  cvrval3(s0, c0, c3, cfv(cbs, c0), c1, cfv(ccvr, c0), c6, c5, c7)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(ccvr, c0))
  rexbii(s0, c6, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), c5, c3)), wceq(co(c3, c7, cv(s0)), c1)), wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), c5, c3)), wceq(c1, co(c3, c7, cv(s0)))))

  diff.cfv.s(s0, ccvr, c0)

blocks.name: lplnexllnN
blocks.content: Given an atom on a lattice plane, there is a lattice line whose join with the atom equals the plane. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jun-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: lplnnlt
blocks.content: Two lattice planes cannot satisfy the less than relation. (Contributed by NM, 7-Jul-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm lplnnlt(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c3)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cplt, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clpl, c0))
} = {
  pm2.61dne(c1, c3, w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c3)))
  syl5ibcom(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wceq(c1, c3), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c3)), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c1)))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c1)))
  pltirr(c0, chlt, c1, c2, c4)
  notbid(wceq(c1, c3), wbr(c1, c4, c1), wbr(c1, c4, c3))
  breq2(c1, c3, c1, c4)
  necon3ad(c1, c3, w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(c1, c4, c3))
  sylibd(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(c1, c4, c3), wceq(c1, c3), wbr(c1, cfv(cple, c0), c3))
  pltle(c0, chlt, c1, c2, c3, c2, c4, cfv(cple, c0))
  lplncmp(c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(cple, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cple, c0))
}

blocks.name: 2llnjN
blocks.content: The join of two different lattice lines in a lattice plane equals the plane. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jul-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)

thm lvolbase(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  -| wceq(c1, cfv(clvol, c3))
} = {

  sylnib(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(clvol, c3), emptycls), wceq(c1, emptycls))
  n0i(c0, c1)
  eqeq1i(c1, emptycls, cfv(clvol, c3))
  fvprc(c3, clvol)
  simprbda(wcel(c3, universe), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2), wrex(hs0, cfv(clpl, c3), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ccvr, c3), c0)))
  islvol(hs0, c3, universe, c0, c1, c2, cfv(clpl, c3), cfv(ccvr, c3))
  eqid(cfv(ccvr, c3))
  eqid(cfv(clpl, c3))
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(clpl, c3))
}

blocks.name: lvolnle3at
blocks.content: A lattice plane (or lattice line or atom) cannot majorize a lattice volume. (Contributed by NM, 8-Jul-2012.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cple, c0))
  -| wceq(c8, cfv(cjn, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(catm, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clvol, c0))
} = {
  mpd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2)), w3a(wcel(c3, c4), wcel(c5, c4), wcel(c6, c4))), wn(wbr(c1, c7, co(co(c3, c8, c5), c8, c6))), wrex(hs0, cfv(clpl, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ccvr, c0), c1)))

blocks.name: 4at
blocks.content: Four atoms determine a lattice volume uniquely. Three-dimensional analogue of ~ ps-1 and ~ 3at . (Contributed by NM, 11-Jul-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm 4at(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, class c11) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), w3a(wcel(c4, c2), wcel(c5, c2), wcel(c6, c2)), w3a(wcel(c7, c2), wcel(c8, c2), wcel(c9, c2))), w3a(wne(c1, c3), wn(wbr(c4, c10, co(c1, c11, c3))), wn(wbr(c5, c10, co(co(c1, c11, c3), c11, c4))))), wb(wbr(co(co(c1, c11, c3), c11, co(c4, c11, c5)), c10, co(co(c6, c11, c7), c11, co(c8, c11, c9))), wceq(co(co(c1, c11, c3), c11, co(c4, c11, c5)), co(co(c6, c11, c7), c11, co(c8, c11, c9)))))
  -| wceq(c10, cfv(cple, c0))
  -| wceq(c11, cfv(cjn, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(catm, c0))
} = {
  impbid(wa(w3a(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), w3a(wcel(c4, c2), wcel(c5, c2), wcel(c6, c2)), w3a(wcel(c7, c2), wcel(c8, c2), wcel(c9, c2))), w3a(wne(c1, c3), wn(wbr(c4, c10, co(c1, c11, c3))), wn(wbr(c5, c10, co(co(c1, c11, c3), c11, c4))))), wbr(co(co(c1, c11, c3), c11, co(c4, c11, c5)), c10, co(co(c6, c11, c7), c11, co(c8, c11, c9))), wceq(co(co(c1, c11, c3), c11, co(c4, c11, c5)), co(co(c6, c11, c7), c11, co(c8, c11, c9))))

blocks.name: lvolcmp
blocks.content: If two lattice planes are comparable, they are equal. (Contributed by NM, 12-Jul-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm lvolcmp(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wb(wbr(c1, c4, c3), wceq(c1, c3)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cple, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clvol, c0))
} = {
  impbid(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(c1, c4, c3), wceq(c1, c3))
  mpd(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wi(wbr(c1, c4, c3), wceq(c1, c3)), wrex(hs0, cfv(clpl, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ccvr, c0), c1)))
  mpbid(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wrex(hs0, cfv(clpl, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ccvr, c0), c1)), wcel(c1, c2))
  simp2(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2))
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wb(wcel(c1, c2), wrex(hs0, cfv(clpl, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(ccvr, c0), c1))), wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  simp1(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2))
  islvol4(hs0, c0, chlt, c1, cfv(cbs, c0), c2, cfv(clpl, c0), cfv(ccvr, c0))

blocks.name: lvolnltN
blocks.content: Two lattice volumes cannot satisfy the less than relation. (Contributed by NM, 12-Jul-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm lvolnltN(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c3)))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cplt, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clvol, c0))
} = {
  pm2.61dne(c1, c3, w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c3)))
  syl5ibcom(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wceq(c1, c3), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c3)), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c1)))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wn(wbr(c1, c4, c1)))
  pltirr(c0, chlt, c1, c2, c4)
  notbid(wceq(c1, c3), wbr(c1, c4, c1), wbr(c1, c4, c3))
  breq2(c1, c3, c1, c4)
  necon3ad(c1, c3, w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(c1, c4, c3))
  sylibd(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(c1, c4, c3), wceq(c1, c3), wbr(c1, cfv(cple, c0), c3))
  pltle(c0, chlt, c1, c2, c3, c2, c4, cfv(cple, c0))
  lvolcmp(c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(cple, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cple, c0))
}

thm 2lplnja(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, class c11) {
  |- wi(w3a(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2)), w3a(wcel(c3, c4), wcel(c5, c4), wcel(c6, c4)), wa(wne(c3, c5), wn(wbr(c6, c7, co(c3, c8, c5))))), wa(w3a(wcel(c9, c4), wcel(c10, c4), wcel(c11, c4)), wa(wne(c9, c10), wn(wbr(c11, c7, co(c9, c8, c10))))), w3a(wbr(co(co(c3, c8, c5), c8, c6), c7, c1), wbr(co(co(c9, c8, c10), c8, c11), c7, c1), wne(co(co(c3, c8, c5), c8, c6), co(co(c9, c8, c10), c8, c11)))), wceq(co(co(co(c3, c8, c5), c8, c6), c8, co(co(c9, c8, c10), c8, c11)), c1))

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clvol, c0))

blocks.name: 2lplnj
blocks.content: The join of two different lattice planes in a (3-dimensional) lattice volume equals the volume. (Contributed by NM, 12-Jul-2012.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c5, cfv(clvol, c0))
} = {

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3))‚Üí(c1[c7]c3)‚àà c8)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(le ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(meet ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c8 =(LLines ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(LPlanes ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(LVols ` c0)
} = {
  mpbird((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3)), (c1[c7]c3)‚àà c8, c3 ‚àà c2)
  syl31anc((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3)), ((c1[c7]c3)‚àà c8 ‚Üî c3 ‚àà c2), c0 ‚àà HL, (c1[c7]c3)‚àà(Base ` c0), c3 ‚àà(Base ` c0), (c1[c7]c3)[(<o ` c0)]c3)
  syl3anc((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3)), (c1[c7]c3)‚àà(Base ` c0), c0 ‚àà Lat, c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0), c3 ‚àà(Base ` c0))
  latmcl(c0, c1, (Base ` c0), c3, c7)
  mpbird((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3)), (c1[c7]c3)[(<o ` c0)]c3, c1[(<o ` c0)](c1[(join ` c0)]c3))
  syl31anc((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3)), c1[(<o ` c0)](c1[(join ` c0)]c3), c0 ‚àà HL, c1 ‚àà c2, (c1[(join ` c0)]c3)‚àà c5, c1[c6](c1[(join ` c0)]c3))
  eqeltrd((c1[(join ` c0)]c3), c5, c4, (c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3)))
  2lplnj(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, (join ` c0))
  simp23(c0 ‚àà HL, c1 ‚àà c2, c3 ‚àà c2, c4 ‚àà c5, (c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3))
  syl3anc((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3)), c1[c6](c1[(join ` c0)]c3), c0 ‚àà Lat, c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0), c3 ‚àà(Base ` c0))
  3ad2ant1(c0 ‚àà HL, (c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5), (c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3), c0 ‚àà Lat)
  hllat(c0)
  latlej1(c0, c1, (Base ` c0), c3, c6, (join ` c0))
  lplncvrlvol2(c0, c1, c2, (c1[(join ` c0)]c3), c5, c6, (<o ` c0))
  syl3anc((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3)), ((c1[c7]c3)[(<o ` c0)]c3 ‚Üî c1[(<o ` c0)](c1[(join ` c0)]c3)), c0 ‚àà HL, c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0), c3 ‚àà(Base ` c0))
  simp1(c0 ‚àà HL, (c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5), (c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3))
  syl((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3)), c1 ‚àà(Base ` c0), c1 ‚àà c2)
  simp21(c0 ‚àà HL, c1 ‚àà c2, c3 ‚àà c2, c4 ‚àà c5, (c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3))

  syl((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c3 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3)), c3 ‚àà(Base ` c0), c3 ‚àà c2)
  simp22(c0 ‚àà HL, c1 ‚àà c2, c3 ‚àà c2, c4 ‚àà c5, (c1[c6]c4 ‚àß c3[c6]c4 ‚àß c1 ‚â† c3))
  lplnbase(c3, c2, (Base ` c0), c0)
  cvrexch(c0, c1, (Base ` c0), c3, c7, (<o ` c0), (join ` c0))
  eqid((join ` c0))
  llncvrlpln(c0, (c1[c7]c3), (Base ` c0), c3, (<o ` c0), c8, c2)

blocks.name: 2lplnmj
blocks.content: The meet of two lattice planes is a lattice line iff their join is a lattice volume. (Contributed by NM, 13-Jul-2012.)

thm 2lplnmj(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wb(wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), c7)))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cjn, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cmee, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(clln, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clpl, c0))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(clvol, c0))
} = {
  3bitr4d(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), c7), wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(ccvr, c0), c3), wbr(c1, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c1, c6, c3)))
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wb(wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(ccvr, c0), c3), wbr(c1, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c1, c6, c3))), wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c3, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  cvrexch(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c0), c3, c4, cfv(ccvr, c0), c6)
  impbida(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5), wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(ccvr, c0), c3))
  syl31anc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5)), wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(ccvr, c0), c3), wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5), wcel(c3, c2), wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(cple, c0), c3))
  simpl1(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5))
  simpr(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5))
  simpl3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5))
  adantr(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5), wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(cple, c0), c3))
  syl3an(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(cple, c0), c3), wcel(c0, clat), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c3, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  latmle2(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c0), c3, c4, cfv(cple, c0))
  llncvrlpln2(c0, co(c1, c4, c3), c5, c3, c2, cfv(cple, c0), cfv(ccvr, c0))
  mpbird(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(ccvr, c0), c3)), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5), wcel(c3, c2))
  simpl3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(ccvr, c0), c3))
  sylan(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(ccvr, c0), c3), wb(wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), c5), wcel(c3, c2)), w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c3, cfv(cbs, c0))))
  3jca(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c3, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  syl3an(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c0, clat), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c3, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  latmcl(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c0), c3, c4)
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  llncvrlpln(c0, co(c1, c4, c3), cfv(cbs, c0), c3, cfv(ccvr, c0), c5, c2)
  impbida(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), c7), wbr(c1, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c1, c6, c3)))
  syl31anc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), c7)), wbr(c1, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c1, c6, c3)), wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), c7), wbr(c1, cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c6, c3)))
  simpl1(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), c7))
  simpl2(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), c7))
  simpr(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), c7))
  adantr(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), c7), wbr(c1, cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c6, c3)))
  syl3an(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wbr(c1, cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c6, c3)), wcel(c0, clat), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c3, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  latlej1(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c0), c3, cfv(cple, c0), c6)
  lplncvrlvol2(c0, c1, c2, co(c1, c6, c3), c7, cfv(cple, c0), cfv(ccvr, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cple, c0))
  mpbid(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(c1, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c1, c6, c3))), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), c7), wcel(c1, c2))
  simpl2(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wbr(c1, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c1, c6, c3)))
  sylan(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(c1, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c1, c6, c3)), wb(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), c7)), w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), cfv(cbs, c0))))
  3jca(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), cfv(cbs, c0)))
  simp1(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  syl3an(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(co(c1, c6, c3), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c0, clat), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c3, cfv(cbs, c0)))
  hllat(c0)
  lplnbase(c1, c2, cfv(cbs, c0), c0)
  lplnbase(c3, c2, cfv(cbs, c0), c0)
  latjcl(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c0), c3, c6)
  lplncvrlvol(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c0), co(c1, c6, c3), cfv(ccvr, c0), c2, c7)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(ccvr, c0))
}

  simpl3(c0 ‚àà HL, c1 ‚àà c2, c3 ‚àà c2, (c1[c4]c3)[(<o ` c0)]c3)

blocks.name: dalemrot
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ dath . Rotate triangles ` Y = P Q R ` and ` Z = S T U ` to allow reuse of analogous proofs. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-2012.)

blocks.name: dalemcea
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ dath . Frequently-used utility lemma. Here we show that ` C ` must be an atom. This is an assumption in most presentations of Desargues's theorem; instead, we assume only the ` C ` is a lattice element, in order to make later substitutions for ` C ` easier. (Contributed by NM, 23-Sep-2012.)

blocks.name: dalem17
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ dath . When planes ` Y ` and ` Z ` are equal, the center of perspectivity ` C ` is in ` Y ` . (Contributed by NM, 1-Aug-2012.)

  simp2(w0, wceq(c0, c1), w1)
  breqtrd(c4, c3, co(cv(s0), c5, cv(s1)), co(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0)), w3a(w0, wceq(c0, c1), w1))
  3ad2ant3(w0, wceq(c0, c1), w1, wbr(c4, c3, co(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0))))

  syl3anc(w3a(w0, wceq(c0, c1), w1), wceq(co(cv(s1), c5, cv(s0)), co(cv(s0), c5, cv(s1))), wcel(c6, chlt), wcel(cv(s1), c2), wcel(cv(s0), c2))
  3ad2ant1(w0, wceq(c0, c1), w1, wcel(c6, chlt))

}

  breq2d(s1, c3, c0, c1, (w0 ‚àß c0 = c1 ‚àß w1))
  simp2(w0, c0 = c1, w1)
  breqtrd(c4, c3, (s0[c5]s1), (s1[c5]s0), (w0 ‚àß c0 = c1 ‚àß w1))

  syl3anc((w0 ‚àß c0 = c1 ‚àß w1), (s1[c5]s0)=(s0[c5]s1), c6 ‚àà HL, s1 ‚àà c2, s0 ‚àà c2)

thm dalemrotps(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, class c11, class c12, class c13, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, w1), w3a(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wn(wbr(cv(s0), c1, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5))), w3a(wne(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wbr(cv(s1), c1, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5))), wbr(c6, c1, co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))))))
  -| wb(w0, w3a(w3a(wa(wcel(c7, chlt), wcel(c6, cfv(cbs, c7))), w3a(wcel(c5, c0), wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c4, c0)), w3a(wcel(c8, c0), wcel(c9, c0), wcel(c10, c0))), wa(wcel(c11, c12), wcel(c13, c12)), w3a(w3a(wn(wbr(c6, c1, co(c5, c3, c2))), wn(wbr(c6, c1, co(c2, c3, c4))), wn(wbr(c6, c1, co(c4, c3, c5)))), w3a(wn(wbr(c6, c1, co(c8, c3, c9))), wn(wbr(c6, c1, co(c9, c3, c10))), wn(wbr(c6, c1, co(c10, c3, c8)))), w3a(wbr(c6, c1, co(c5, c3, c8)), wbr(c6, c1, co(c2, c3, c9)), wbr(c6, c1, co(c4, c3, c10))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cple, c7))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cjn, c7))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(catm, c7))
  -| wb(w1, w3a(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wn(wbr(cv(s0), c1, c11)), w3a(wne(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wbr(cv(s1), c1, c11)), wbr(c6, c1, co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))))))
  -| wceq(c11, co(co(c5, c3, c2), c3, c4))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(w0, w1), w3a(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wn(wbr(cv(s0), c1, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5))), w3a(wne(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wbr(cv(s1), c1, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5))), wbr(c6, c1, co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))))), wceq(c1, cfv(cple, c7)))
  3jca(wa(w0, w1), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wn(wbr(cv(s0), c1, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5))), w3a(wne(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wbr(cv(s1), c1, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5))), wbr(c6, c1, co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1)))))
  adantl(w0, w1, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)))
  jca(w1, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0))
  dalemccea(s0, s1, c0, c1, c11, c6, c3, w1)
  dalemddea(s1, s0, c0, c1, c11, c6, c3, w1)
  mtbid(wa(w0, w1), wbr(cv(s0), c1, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5)), wbr(cv(s0), c1, c11))
  adantl(w0, w1, wn(wbr(cv(s0), c1, c11)))
  dalem-ccly(s0, s1, c1, c11, c0, c6, c3, w1)
  adantr(w0, w1, wb(wbr(cv(s0), c1, c11), wbr(cv(s0), c1, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5))))
  breq2d(cv(s0), c1, c11, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5), w0)
  3jca(wa(w0, w1), wne(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wbr(cv(s1), c1, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5))), wbr(c6, c1, co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))))
  adantl(w0, w1, wne(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  necomd(cv(s1), cv(s0), w1)
  dalemccnedd(s0, s1, c0, c1, c11, c6, c3, w1)
  mtbid(wa(w0, w1), wbr(cv(s1), c1, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5)), wbr(cv(s1), c1, c11))
  adantl(w0, w1, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c1, c11)))
  dalem-ddly(s1, s0, c1, c11, c0, c6, c3, w1)
  adantr(w0, w1, wb(wbr(cv(s1), c1, c11), wbr(cv(s1), c1, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5))))
  breq2d(cv(s1), c1, c11, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5), w0)
  syl6reqr(c11, co(co(c2, c3, c4), c3, c5), co(co(c5, c3, c2), c3, c4), w0)
  dalemqrprot(c2, c3, c4, c5, c7, c6, c0, c8, c9, c10, c11, c12, c13, c1, w0)
  adantl(w0, w1, wbr(c6, c1, co(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))))
  dalemclccjdd(s0, s1, c6, c1, c3, c0, c11, w1)
}

  ‚ä¢ ((w0 ‚àß w1)‚Üí((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c0)‚àß ¬¨ s0[c1]((c2[c3]c4)[c3]c5)‚àß(s1 ‚â† s0 ‚àß ¬¨ s1[c1]((c2[c3]c4)[c3]c5)‚àß c6[c1](s0[c3]s1))))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üî(((c7 ‚àà HL ‚àß c6 ‚àà(Base ` c7))‚àß(c5 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c0)‚àß(c8 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c9 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c10 ‚àà c0))‚àß(c11 ‚àà c12 ‚àß c13 ‚àà c12)‚àß((¬¨ c6[c1](c5[c3]c2)‚àß ¬¨ c6[c1](c2[c3]c4)‚àß ¬¨ c6[c1](c4[c3]c5))‚àß(¬¨ c6[c1](c8[c3]c9)‚àß ¬¨ c6[c1](c9[c3]c10)‚àß ¬¨ c6[c1](c10[c3]c8))‚àß(c6[c1](c5[c3]c8)‚àß c6[c1](c2[c3]c9)‚àß c6[c1](c4[c3]c10)))))
  ‚ä£ c1 =(le ` c7)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(join ` c7)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(Atoms ` c7)
  ‚ä£ (w1 ‚Üî((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c0)‚àß ¬¨ s0[c1]c11 ‚àß(s1 ‚â† s0 ‚àß ¬¨ s1[c1]c11 ‚àß c6[c1](s0[c3]s1))))
  ‚ä£ c11 =((c5[c3]c2)[c3]c4)
} = {
  a1ii(((w0 ‚àß w1)‚Üí((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c0)‚àß ¬¨ s0[c1]((c2[c3]c4)[c3]c5)‚àß(s1 ‚â† s0 ‚àß ¬¨ s1[c1]((c2[c3]c4)[c3]c5)‚àß c6[c1](s0[c3]s1)))), c1 =(le ` c7))
  3jca((w0 ‚àß w1), (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c0), ¬¨ s0[c1]((c2[c3]c4)[c3]c5), (s1 ‚â† s0 ‚àß ¬¨ s1[c1]((c2[c3]c4)[c3]c5)‚àß c6[c1](s0[c3]s1)))
  adantl(w0, w1, (s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c0))
  jca(w1, s0 ‚àà c0, s1 ‚àà c0)
  dalemccea(s0, s1, c0, c1, c11, c6, c3, w1)
  dalemddea(s1, s0, c0, c1, c11, c6, c3, w1)
  mtbid((w0 ‚àß w1), s0[c1]((c2[c3]c4)[c3]c5), s0[c1]c11)

  3jca((w0 ‚àß w1), s1 ‚â† s0, ¬¨ s1[c1]((c2[c3]c4)[c3]c5), c6[c1](s0[c3]s1))
  adantl(w0, w1, s1 ‚â† s0)
  necomd(s1, s0, w1)
  dalemccnedd(s0, s1, c0, c1, c11, c6, c3, w1)
  mtbid((w0 ‚àß w1), s1[c1]((c2[c3]c4)[c3]c5), s1[c1]c11)
  adantl(w0, w1, ¬¨ s1[c1]c11)
  dalem-ddly(s1, s0, c1, c11, c0, c6, c3, w1)

blocks.name: dalemcjden
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ dath . Show that the dummy atoms form a line. (Contributed by NM, 15-Aug-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm dalemcjden(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, class c11, class c12, class c13, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, w1), wcel(co(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), cfv(clln, c1)))
  -| wb(w0, w3a(w3a(wa(wcel(c1, chlt), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, c1))), w3a(wcel(c3, c4), wcel(c5, c4), wcel(c6, c4)), w3a(wcel(c7, c4), wcel(c8, c4), wcel(c9, c4))), wa(wcel(c10, c11), wcel(c12, c11)), w3a(w3a(wn(wbr(c2, c13, co(c3, c0, c5))), wn(wbr(c2, c13, co(c5, c0, c6))), wn(wbr(c2, c13, co(c6, c0, c3)))), w3a(wn(wbr(c2, c13, co(c7, c0, c8))), wn(wbr(c2, c13, co(c8, c0, c9))), wn(wbr(c2, c13, co(c9, c0, c7)))), w3a(wbr(c2, c13, co(c3, c0, c7)), wbr(c2, c13, co(c5, c0, c8)), wbr(c2, c13, co(c6, c0, c9))))))
  -| wceq(c13, cfv(cple, c1))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cjn, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(catm, c1))
  -| wb(w1, w3a(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c4), wcel(cv(s1), c4)), wn(wbr(cv(s0), c13, c10)), w3a(wne(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wn(wbr(cv(s1), c13, c10)), wbr(c2, c13, co(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))))))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(w0, w1), wcel(co(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), cfv(clln, c1))), wceq(c13, cfv(cple, c1)))
  syl31anc(wa(w0, w1), wcel(co(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1)), cfv(clln, c1)), wcel(c1, chlt), wcel(cv(s0), c4), wcel(cv(s1), c4), wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  adantr(w0, w1, wcel(c1, chlt))
  dalemkehl(c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, c8, c9, c10, c11, c12, c13, c0, w0)
  adantl(w0, w1, wcel(cv(s0), c4))
  dalemccea(s0, s1, c4, c13, c10, c2, c0, w1)
  adantl(w0, w1, wcel(cv(s1), c4))
  dalemddea(s1, s0, c4, c13, c10, c2, c0, w1)
  adantl(w0, w1, wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  dalemccnedd(s0, s1, c4, c13, c10, c2, c0, w1)
  llni2(c1, cv(s0), c4, cv(s1), c0, cfv(clln, c1))
  eqid(cfv(clln, c1))
}

blocks.name: dalem51
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ dath . Construct the condition ` ph ` with ` c ` , ` G H I ` , and ` Y ` in place of ` C ` , ` Y ` , and ` Z ` respectively. This lets us reuse the special case of Desargues's theorem where ` Y =/= Z ` , to eventually prove the case where ` Y = Z ` . (Contributed by NM, 16-Aug-2012.)

blocks.content: Lemma for ~ dath . Lines ` G H ` and ` P Q ` intersect at the auxiliary line ` B ` (later shown to be an axis of perspectivity; see ~ dalem60 ). (Contributed by NM, 8-Aug-2012.)

blocks.name: dath
blocks.content: Desargues's theorem of projective geometry (proved for a Hilbert lattice). Assume each triple of atoms (points) ` P Q R ` and ` S T U ` forms a triangle (i.e. determines a plane). Assume that lines ` P S ` , ` Q T ` , and ` R U ` meet at a "center of perspectivity" ` C ` . (We also assume that ` C ` is not on any of the 6 lines forming the two triangles.) Then the atoms ` D = ( P .\/ Q ) ./\ ( S .\/ T ) ` , ` E = ( Q .\/ R ) ./\ ( T .\/ U ) ` , ` F = ( R .\/ P ) ./\ ( U .\/ S ) ` are colinear, forming an "axis of perspectivity". Our proof roughly follows Theorem 2.7.1, p. 78 in Beutelspacher and Rosenbaum, _Projective Geometry: From Foundations to Applications_, Cambridge University Press (1988). Unlike them, we do not assume that ` C ` is an atom to make this theorem slightly more general for easier future use. However, we prove that ` C ` must be an atom in ~ dalemcea . For a visual demonstration, see the "Desargues's theorem" applet at ~ http://www.dynamicgeometry.com/JavaSketchpad/Gallery.html . The points I, J, and K there define the axis of perspectivity. See theorem ~ dalaw for Desargues's law, which eliminates all of the preconditions on the atoms except for central perspectivity. This is Metamath 100 proof #87. (Contributed by NM, 20-Aug-2012.)

blocks.name: lineset
blocks.content: The set of lines in a Hilbert lattice. (Contributed by NM, 19-Sep-2011.)

thm lineset(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cab(s0, wrex(s1, c3, wrex(s2, c3, wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s0), crab(s3, c3, wbr(cv(s3), c4, co(cv(s1), c5, cv(s2)))))))))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cple, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cjn, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(catm, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(clines, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsc(s3, c0)
  -| diffsc(s3, c3)
} = {
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cab(s0, wrex(s1, c3, wrex(s2, c3, wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s0), crab(s3, c3, wbr(cv(s3), c4, co(cv(s1), c5, cv(s2)))))))))), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  syl5eq(c2, cab(s0, wrex(s1, c3, wrex(s2, c3, wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s0), crab(s3, c3, wbr(cv(s3), c4, co(cv(s1), c5, cv(s2))))))))), cfv(clines, c0), wcel(c0, universe))
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, universe, clines, cab(s0, wrex(s1, c3, wrex(s2, c3, wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s0), crab(s3, c3, wbr(cv(s3), c4, co(cv(s1), c5, cv(s2))))))))), cab(s0, wrex(s1, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), wrex(s2, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s0), crab(s3, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cple, cv(hs0)), co(cv(s1), cfv(cjn, cv(hs0)), cv(s2))))))))))

  rexeqbidv(s1, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), c3, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wrex(s2, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s0), crab(s3, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cple, cv(hs0)), co(cv(s1), cfv(cjn, cv(hs0)), cv(s2))))))), wrex(s2, c3, wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s0), crab(s3, c3, wbr(cv(s3), c4, co(cv(s1), c5, cv(s2))))))))
  rexeqbidv(s2, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), c3, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s0), crab(s3, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cple, cv(hs0)), co(cv(s1), cfv(cjn, cv(hs0)), cv(s2)))))), wa(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s0), crab(s3, c3, wbr(cv(s3), c4, co(cv(s1), c5, cv(s2)))))))
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s0), crab(s3, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cple, cv(hs0)), co(cv(s1), cfv(cjn, cv(hs0)), cv(s2))))), wceq(cv(s0), crab(s3, c3, wbr(cv(s3), c4, co(cv(s1), c5, cv(s2))))))

  syl6eqr(cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(catm, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))

  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, cab(s0, wrex(s1, c3, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1)))))), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  syl5eq(c2, cab(s0, wrex(s1, c3, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1))))), cfv(cpointsN, c0), wcel(c0, universe))
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, universe, cpointsN, cab(s0, wrex(s1, c3, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1))))), cab(s0, wrex(s1, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1))))))
  abbidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wrex(s1, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1)))), wrex(s1, c3, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1)))))
  rexeqdv(s1, cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), c3, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1))))
  syl6eqr(cfv(catm, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(catm, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, catm)
  df-pointsN(hs0, s0, s1)
  abrexex(s0, s1, c3, csn(cv(s1)))

  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.c(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c3, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1))))))

  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí c2 = { s0 | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c3, s0 = { s1 })})
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Atoms ` c0)

thm ispointN(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

thm atpointN(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚Üí { c2 } ‚àà c4)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Atoms ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(Points ` c0)
} = {
  mpbird((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3), { c2 } ‚àà c4, ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà c3, { c2 } = { hs0 }))
  adantl(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà c3, { c2 } = { hs0 }))
  mpan2(c2 ‚àà c3, ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà c3, { c2 } = { hs0 }), { c2 } = { c2 })
  eqid({ c2 })
  rspceeqv(hs0, c2, c3, { c2 }, { c2 }, { hs0 })

  ispointN(hs0, c0, c1, { c2 }, c4, c3)

}

thm psubspi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5)), wrex(s0, c2, wrex(s1, c2, wbr(c4, c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1)))))), wcel(c4, c2))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cple, c0))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(cjn, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(catm, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cpsubsp, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
} = {
  3imp1(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5), wrex(s0, c2, wrex(s1, c2, wbr(c4, c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))))), wcel(c4, c2))
  syl6(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wi(wcel(c4, c5), wi(wrex(s0, c2, wrex(s1, c2, wbr(c4, c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))))), wcel(c4, c2))), wral(hs0, c5, wi(wrex(s0, c2, wrex(s1, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  ex(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wral(hs0, c5, wi(wrex(s0, c2, wrex(s1, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  simplbda(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wral(hs0, c5, wi(wrex(s0, c2, wrex(s1, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))), wss(c2, c5))
  ispsubsp2(hs0, s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c5, c6, c7)
  rspccv(hs0, c5, c4, wi(wrex(s0, c2, wrex(s1, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wi(wrex(s0, c2, wrex(s1, c2, wbr(c4, c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))))), wcel(c4, c2)))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c4), wrex(s0, c2, wrex(s1, c2, wbr(cv(hs0), c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wrex(s0, c2, wrex(s1, c2, wbr(c4, c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))))), wcel(c4, c2))
  2rexbidv(s0, s1, c2, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), c4), wbr(cv(hs0), c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))), wbr(c4, c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))))
  breq1(cv(hs0), c4, c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1)))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), c4, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wrex(s0, c2, wrex(s1, c2, wbr(c4, c6, co(cv(s0), c7, cv(s1))))), wcel(c4, c2)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c4)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c4)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

thm psubspi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {
  ‚ä¢ (((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c2, c4[c6](s0[c7]s1))))‚Üí c4 ‚àà c2)
  ‚ä£ c6 =(le ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c7 =(join ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(Atoms ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(PSubSp ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c5)
} = {
  3imp1(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, c4 ‚àà c5, ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c2, c4[c6](s0[c7]s1))), c4 ‚àà c2)
  syl6(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, (c4 ‚àà c5 ‚Üí(‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c2, c4[c6](s0[c7]s1)))‚Üí c4 ‚àà c2)), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c5,(‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c2, hs0[c6](s0[c7]s1)))‚Üí hs0 ‚àà c2)))
  ex(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c5,(‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c2, hs0[c6](s0[c7]s1)))‚Üí hs0 ‚àà c2)))
  simplbda(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c5,(‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c2, hs0[c6](s0[c7]s1)))‚Üí hs0 ‚àà c2)), c2 ‚äÜ c5)
  ispsubsp2(hs0, s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c5, c6, c7)
  rspccv(hs0, c5, c4, (‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c2, hs0[c6](s0[c7]s1)))‚Üí hs0 ‚àà c2), (‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c2, c4[c6](s0[c7]s1)))‚Üí c4 ‚àà c2))
  imbi12d(hs0 = c4, ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c2, hs0[c6](s0[c7]s1))), hs0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c2, c4[c6](s0[c7]s1))), c4 ‚àà c2)
  2rexbidv(s0, s1, c2, c2, hs0 = c4, hs0[c6](s0[c7]s1), c4[c6](s0[c7]s1))
  breq1(hs0, c4, c6, (s0[c7]s1))
  eleq1(hs0, c4, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.w((‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c2, c4[c6](s0[c7]s1)))‚Üí c4 ‚àà c2))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c4)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, c4)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

  ‚ä¢ (((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c4 ‚àà c5)‚àß(c6 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c7 ‚àà c2 ‚àß c4[c8](c6[c9]c7)))‚Üí c4 ‚àà c2)

  ralrimivv(hs1, hs2, csn(c1), csn(c1), wa(wcel(c0, cal), wcel(c1, c2)), wral(hs0, c2, wi(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cple, c0), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cjn, c0), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs0), csn(c1)))))
  ralrimdv(hs0, c2, wa(wcel(c0, cal), wcel(c1, c2)), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(c1)), wcel(cv(hs2), csn(c1))), wi(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cple, c0), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cjn, c0), cv(hs2))), wcel(cv(hs0), csn(c1))))

  3imtr4g(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cal), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), csn(c1)), wcel(cv(hs2), csn(c1))), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cple, c0), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cjn, c0), cv(hs2)))), wcel(cv(hs0), csn(c1)), wa(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), c1), wceq(cv(hs2), c1)), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, cfv(cjn, c0), c1))), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))

  sylbid(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cal), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, cfv(cjn, c0), c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cple, c0), c1))
  breq2d(cv(hs0), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, cfv(cjn, c0), c1), c1, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cal), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))

  snssi(c1, c2)

blocks.name: pointpsubN
blocks.content: A point (singleton of an atom) is a projective subspace. Remark below Definition 15.1 of [MaedaMaeda] p. 61. (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2011.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm pointpsubN(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cal), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(c1, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cpointsN, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cpsubsp, c0))
} = {
  imp(wcel(c0, cal), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, c3))
  sylbid(wcel(c0, cal), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, c3), wrex(hs0, cfv(catm, c0), wceq(c1, csn(cv(hs0)))))
  ispointN(hs0, c0, cal, c1, c2, cfv(catm, c0))
  rexlimdv(hs0, cfv(catm, c0), wcel(c0, cal), wceq(c1, csn(cv(hs0))), wcel(c1, c3))
  syl6(wcel(c0, cal), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(catm, c0)), wi(wceq(c1, csn(cv(hs0))), wcel(c1, c3)), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), c3))
  ex(wcel(c0, cal), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(catm, c0)), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), c3))
  snatpsubN(c0, cv(hs0), cfv(catm, c0), c3)
  eqid(cfv(catm, c0))
  eleq1a(csn(cv(hs0)), c3, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(catm, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cal))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c1, c3))
}

thm pointpsubN(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà AtLat ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí c1 ‚àà c3)

  syl6(c0 ‚àà AtLat, hs0 ‚àà(Atoms ` c0), (c1 = { hs0 } ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c3), { hs0 } ‚àà c3)
  ex(c0 ‚àà AtLat, hs0 ‚àà(Atoms ` c0), { hs0 } ‚àà c3)

  eqid((Atoms ` c0))
  eleq1a({ hs0 }, c3, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c((Atoms ` c0))
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ‚àà AtLat)
  diff.hs0.w(c1 ‚àà c3)
}

thm pmap11(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

  bitr3d(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wceq(c1, c3), wa(wss(cfv(c4, c1), cfv(c4, c3)), wss(cfv(c4, c3), cfv(c4, c1))), wa(wbr(c1, cfv(cple, c0), c3), wbr(c3, cfv(cple, c0), c1)))

  pmaple(c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(cple, c0), c4)

blocks.name: pmapglbx
blocks.content: The projective map of the GLB of a set of lattice elements. Index-set version of ~ pmapglb , where we read ` S ` as ` S ( i ) ` . Theorem 15.5.2 of [MaedaMaeda] p. 62. (Contributed by NM, 5-Dec-2011.)

thm pmapglb(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wss(c1, c2), wne(c1, emptycls)), wceq(cfv(c3, cfv(c4, c1)), ciin(s0, c1, cfv(c3, cv(s0)))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cglb, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cpmap, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)

thm isline4N(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà HL ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí((c3 ` c1)‚àà c4 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c5, s0[c6]c1)))
